INGREDIENTS REQUIRED- 
• Eggs - 10 
• Potato - ¾ kg 
• Breads - 10 
• Onions - 4 
• Coriander leaves - 2 tablespoons 
• Mint leaves - 1 tablespoon (optional) 
• Salt - as required 
• Chilly powder - 1 teaspoon 
• Green chilly paste - 1 teaspoon 
• Garam masala powder - 1 teaspoon 
• Dhania powder - 2 teaspoons 
• Oil (for deep frying) - as required
 
METHOD 
1. Boil eggs, remove shells and keep aside. 
2. Slice vertically into two pieces. 
3. Boil potatoes, peel and mash. 
4. Soak bread slice one by one in water, squeeze and add it to mashed potatoes with finely cut onions, coriander, mint leaves and other masala powders. 
5. Mix like a thick dough. Divide the dough into 20 equal portions. 
6. Take one portion, make like a ball, make a dent inside, keep an egg piece inside. 
7. Shape like cutlets, and cover properly. 
8. Deep fry in hot oil. 
9. Serve with ketchup or mint chutney. 
10. Channa masala also goes very well with these tikkis.
